definition: the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: Today is not my day because I lost my purse.
sentences.chinese: 今天是我的背運日，因爲我的錢包丟了。

sentences.english: Of course, as Ferguson would remind you, United had its share of poor calls, too.
sentences.chinese: 當然，弗格森會提醒你，曼聯也有走背運的時候。

sentences.english: The lucky country's reversal of fortune could hardly have been starker .
sentences.chinese: 這個曾經的幸運國背運幾乎背到家了。

sentences.english: I have a very superstitious friend called Mack.
sentences.chinese: 七年的背運我有個非常迷信的朋友名叫麥克。

sentences.english: He tells the boy of his plan to end his bad luck .
sentences.chinese: 他告訴男孩他的計劃，如何來結束他的背運。

sentences.english: It is thought to be back luck to wish someone good luck directly.
sentences.chinese: 人們認爲直接祝願某人好運反而會背運。

sentences.english: A hex is believed to be an evil spell that is put on someone.
sentences.chinese: 背運據說是指被人用咒語鎮住了。
